inTrain <- sample(nrow(Carseats), 0.5*nrow(Carseats))
#
train <- data.frame(df[inTrain,])
temp <- data.frame(df[-inTrain,])
inTrain2 <- sample(nrow(temp), 0.5*nrow(temp))
validation <- data.frame(temp[inTrain2,])
test <- data.frame(temp[-inTrain2,])
rm(temp)

##
tree.credit = tree(PROFITABLE ~ ., data = train)
summary(tree.credit)
tree.pred = predict(tree.credit, validation, type = "class")
confusion = table(tree.pred, validation$PROFITABLE)
confusion
Error = (confusion[1, 2] + confusion[2, 1]) / sum(confusion)
Error

#
Size <- 1:20
Error <- rep(0,length(Size))

#
table(validation$PROFITABLE)

Error[1] = 131/269

#
for (i in 2:20) {
  prune.credit = prune.misclass(tree.credit, best = i)
  tree.pred = predict(prune.credit, validation , type = "class")
  confusion = table(tree.pred, validation$PROFITABLE)
  Error[i] = (confusion[1, 2] + confusion[2, 1]) / sum(confusion)
}
plot(Size, Error, type = "o", xlab = "Tree Size", ylab = "Error Rate", col = "blue")
z = which.min(Error)

#
# Now plot the best pruned tree
prune.credit = prune.misclass(tree.credit, best = z)
plot(prune.credit)
text(prune.credit, pretty = 0)
tree.pred = predict(prune.credit, test, type = "class")
confusion = table(tree.pred, test$PROFITABLE)
confusion
Error = (confusion[1, 2] + confusion[2, 1]) / sum(confusion)
Error
